result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

NOH for p/s went to defendant at DCDF

Review hearing at 02-10-2016 08:15 am.
Preliminary hearing at 02-18-2016 08:30 am.

Defendant Edward T. Linn in court, in custody.  Yolanda J. Tienstra appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Discussion held regarding attorney; Court attempts to contact Atty Gonzalez  Review hearing scheduled for February 10, 2016 at 08:15 am.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 18, 2016 at 08:30 am.
State of Wisconsin apprs by Atty Jim Sempf.  DEF, Edward Linn apprs in person; in custody.  DEF heard/has Atty Gonzalez.  So ordered.

Review hearing at 01-13-2016 08:15 am.
Preliminary hearing at 02-04-2016 08:30 am.

8:14. Defendant, Edward T. Linn, in court.  Attorney  James T. Sempf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court questions Deft.  Deft requests continuance on PH.  Court grants.  Review hearing scheduled for January 13, 2016 at 08:15 am.

Defendant shall not have any violent or abusive contact with anyone.  Defendant shall not consume alcohol or other intoxicants.  Defendant must maintain absolute sobriety  and shall not go upon the premises of any establishment whose primary business activity involves the sale or distribution of alcoholic beverages, including bars, taverns, liquor stores and beer tents.  The Jail shall permit Defendant to make a phone call at the county expense for bail purposes.

(12:47) Defendant Edward T. Linn in custody via video with attorney Greg E. Vollan (jail only, will hire Jason Gonzalez out of Madision).  Gilbert Grant Thompson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant has received copy of Criminal Complaint and advised of rights, charges, penalties and right to Preliminary Hearing. Court finds probable cause. State heard on bond, $5,000 Cash; Prelim requested within time limits. Prelim 1/7/16 at 8:30am in Br. 4 & Review hearing 1/6/16 at 8:15am in Br. 4; Court sets $5,000 CASH BOND with conditions:  Defendant shall not consume alcohol or other intoxicants.  Defendant must maintain absolute sobriety  and shall not go upon the premises of any establishment whose primary business activity involves the sale or distribution of alcoholic beverages, including bars, taverns, liquor stores and beer tents.  Defendant shall not have any violent or abusive contact with anyone.  The Jail shall permit Defendant to make a phone call at the county expense for bail purposes.
